body_html:
@jart

...
____Loading package: @jsoncpp_git//
____Timeout connecting to https://github.com/polymerelements/iron-icon/archive/v1.0.11.tar.gz
...

...
____Loading package: @numericjs_numeric_min_js//file
____Timeout connecting to https://github.com/webcomponents/webcomponentsjs/archive/v0.7.22.tar.gz
...

...
____Downloading http://bazel-mirror.storage.googleapis.com/github.com/google/boringssl/archive/bbcaa15b0647816b9a1a9b9e0d209cd6712f0105.tar.gz: 4,707,593 bytes
____Timeout connecting to https://github.com/polymerelements/iron-input/archive/1.0.10.tar.gz
...

But I can download these packages via browser.
And after all download procedure the builder fails again with same message:

The command '/bin/sh -c tensorflow/tools/ci_build/builds/configured GPU bazel build -c opt --config=cuda tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package && bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/pip && pip --no-cache-dir install --upgrade /tmp/pip/tensorflow-*.whl && rm -rf /tmp/pip && rm -rf /root/.cache' returned a non-zero code: 2

If that is the real cause, could I just manually add them?

If that is the real cause, could I just manually add them?
